intro: Tetradyas perfoliata, commonly known as the perfoliate tetradyas, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its distinctive leaves that are often perforated or have a perfoliate arrangement, giving it its common name. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in umbels, a typical feature of the Apiaceae family. Tetradyas perfoliata is typically found in moist, shaded environments and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
